channel.title: Looking For A Website Partner
channel.description:
I have a great website idea (at least in my opinion) that I've never seen used on any other site. I bought a domain, 6 months of hosting, and a wordpress template off templatemonster that I'm currently editing and setting up the site with. I think it's possible for this site to go big if done right for sure. I actually made a smaller version of the site when i was in highschool and it got pretty big in my city and surrounding cities. Now I'm looking to remake it and make it bigger.
I'm looking for someone to partner up with me in making the site. I'm looking for someone who has some free time to help work and improve the site with me. Someone who preferably can code html,css,php, etc. The more the better. If you're interested please let me know what coding experience you have and any sites of your own. If I think your suitable , I'll PM you the website details and we can go from there.

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:31, topic:426030”][quote author=mikeap4 link=topic=528717.msg3857498#msg3857498 date=1324439013]

videos of kids damaging cars and property

Wtf… no…

nobody is going to steal your idea, ideas are 100% worthless, the value is in implementation

Well id like a headstart on it before anyone else works on it…

But this is getting rediculous, i didnt ask anyone to do anything complicated. All i asked was for someone to post their skills then ill send them a pm about the website… You post your skills and in return you get my idea in which you might actually want to create with me. How hard is that really? If no one can do/wants to do this ill go on another forum where someone will…
[/quote]
it was a joke about something that happened here awhile ago.[/quote]

Oh lol i thought you were serious, i was like what the hell? Haha

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @sspoke sspoke
item.description:
@sspoke wrote:

Mopman:

nobody is going to steal your idea, ideas are 100% worthless, the value is in implementation

ideas are patented… not the actual product… a idea also known as a business model patent (a method of doing some idea) could be worth a million dollars.

You may think selling RSGP… or any type of virtual goods is not profitable… but once you made over 50k$ usd in sales… you’ll start to realize you can make money out of anything as long as you think it’s a good idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:25, topic:426030”]>want people to work on your site for free

call them retards[/quote]

Again it wouldnt be my site, it would be ours. We’d both work on it, thats what a partnership is. Im not looking for an employee, im looking for a partner who WANTS to work on a project with me. I said i would pm the idea and from there, YOU COULD decide if you want to be partof the project or not. Mopman your a fuckin moron.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Dunning–Kruger effect

In the field of psychology, the Dunning–Kruger effect is a cognitive bias wherein people of low ability have illusory superiority, mistakenly assessing their cognitive ability as greater than it is. The cognitive bias of illusory superiority derives from the metacognitive inability of low-ability persons to recognize their own ineptitude; without the self-awareness of metacognition, low-ability people cannot objectively evaluate their actual competence or incompetence. Conversely, highly competen...

huehuehue

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:19, topic:426030”]“If it becomes big and makes money” is just another way of saying “you aint getting anything”.

As people said, if you don’t want to post your idea, at least give some indication of what skills you bring to the potential partnership[/quote]

Jesus im done trying, ill go to a different site. My main skill is i beleive i have an idea which i think could become HUGE and i can work on the site (as im doing now). This idea is unique and never used before and a good one at that (not easy to come up with a good unique website idea thats not already made). If you are too lazy to wrte up your skills then receive a pm of me telling you the idea, for you to accept or deny working on, then indont want you working with me anyway.

So im done goin back and forth. If anyone else is interested just post up your skills and if it looks like you can code at least decently. ill pm you the details.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

Mopman:

You’re asking people to work for free, actually you’re asking quite a lot.

No… If you partner with me. The site wont be just mine, it will be ours. You will own half the site. If it does become big and we make money, you get half. And i already bought hosting, the domain, and a template. Im not looking for an employee, im looking for a partner. We both would work on the site IF you like the idea and agree to partner up with me and make it.

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:15, topic:426030”]mikeap4: The problem is that everyone here doubt your skills and your idea. If you are not open about what you are doing you will only get noobs to help you.

Lets say I had some knowledge in PHP, HTML and CSS, why should I want to help you?[/quote]

My skills arnt great but im not horrible either. But my idea makes up for it. Why should you want to help me? Why wouldnt you want to help yourself?

Let me put this simpler than i have already. Im not saying any of you HAVE to join me. But if your looking to make a website that could possibly become a big site, i have an idea for a site that could do just that. Now if you have your own idea, great, go make it happen. But if not, why not post your skills here and possibly be able to join me in making the site. Like i said… If you have some good skills, post here and I WILL PM YOU AND TELL YOU THE IDEA. From there you can decide if you want to join me or not. The site wouldnt be just mine, it would be ours so you arnt just helping me, we will be helping each other.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:8, topic:426030”]You’re missing the point, you need to explain what skills YOU have (common courtesy in a partnership, surely?), along with some sort of outline of what you expect of the person (not “php, html and css” :|) and a brief outline of the project ahead before anyone here is going to consider helping you. Protip: If you can’t explain the general idea of your site without giving away your big secret its probably not worth while. When they pitched Google they could tell everyone it’s a search engine because it was the algorithm that made it unique, likewise Facebook, Reddit, YouTube could all be described without ruining what made the sites so potentially popular.

For all we know you’re just another guy with his “big” idea that doesn’t actually have a clue what he’s doing, and it certainly sounds like it considering the only information we have is what I assume is shared hosting and a wordpress install with a template monster theme… so what exactly are you planning on doing in this partnership?

EDIT: It has just occurred me to you could be doing some fun community none profit driven idea. In which case you should have said so.[/quote]

Alright heres what ill say… This is not a get rich quick site, a gpt or any kind of ads site, and we arnt selling anything. This will be a media website containing “certain kind of videos” (not porn… lol) Which in my opinion could become huge (not right away of course, will take some time). I can see teens in highschools everywhere using this site but at the same time my dad whos 40 would even use the site. Im not making it to make money but i can deffinitly see it becoming a popular site in the future and making money.

I myself can only code in html and edit php and css a little. But by partnering with me you get my idea, someone to bounce ideas off with (i have some geat ideas for the site), and someone to work with. I can easily do all the main things by myself but would like someone to work with and help with the little bit more complicated things. We can also add another partner if we need one, but i doubt we will at least until/if the site gets bigger.

Heres what ill do, someone who is trusted here and is good at webdesigning, ill send them my idea and they can either join in with me or not its up to them, but they can post here their thoughts of the idea

Read full topic

item.title: Looking For A Website Partner
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You’re missing the point, you need to explain what skills YOU have (common courtesy in a partnership, surely?), along with some sort of outline of what you expect of the person (not “php, html and css” :|) and a brief outline of the project ahead before anyone here is going to consider helping you. Protip: If you can’t explain the general idea of your site without giving away your big secret its probably not worth while. When they pitched Google they could tell everyone it’s a search engine because it was the algorithm that made it unique, likewise Facebook, Reddit, YouTube could all be described without ruining what made the sites so potentially popular.

For all we know you’re just another guy with his “big” idea that doesn’t actually have a clue what he’s doing, and it certainly sounds like it considering the only information we have is what I assume is shared hosting and a wordpress install with a template monster theme… so what exactly are you planning on doing in this partnership?

EDIT: It has just occurred me to you could be doing some fun community none profit driven idea. In which case you should have said so.

Read full topic
